translationTemplates.TranslationTemplate: A regular expression. All files in the test object where the file name matches the regular expression will be check in the test, all other will be excluded. The default value '.*' matches all files.

A regular expression. All test assertions in the executable test suite where the label matches the regular expression will be used in the test run, all other will be skipped. The default value '.*' matches all test assertions.

The maximum number of errors to report for each test assertion. If more errors are found, only the selected number of messages will be reported including an information about the total number of errors found.
Filename
Feature Type
Feature Count
In cases where the referenced test case fails, the test object is not in a condition that this test case could reliably be evaluated.
Error loading a document. Error information: {text}
There are too many errors to determine all errors. Only the first {count} errors in the system under test are analysed.
The dataset has {count} file(s) with errors for this assertion.
The dataset has {count} feature(s) with errors for this assertion.
XML document '{filename}': The file has {count} error(s).

XML document '{filename}': The root element is not a GML feature and not one of the recognised feature collections: wfs:FeatureCollection (WFS 2.0), gml:FeatureCollection (GML 3.2) or base:SpatialDataSet (INSPIRE Base schema 3.2 or 3.3). The name of the root element is '{elementName}' in namespace '{namespace}'. It is recommended to use the WFS 2.0 feature collection element in INSPIRE.
XML document '{filename}': UTF-8 encoding expected. The XML declaration of the document states that '{encoding}' is used as the character encoding.
XML document '{filename}': The root element does not have an xsi:schemaLocation attribute. The document cannot be validated.
XML document '{filename}': The file has {count} schema validation error(s).
XML document '{filename}': {error}

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have an empty value: {propertyNames}. While this is valid against the XML schema, this is not valid according to the GML model. Please correct the process that generates the GML documents.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have a nilReason attribute, but xsi:nil is not set to 'true': {propertyNames}. This is an error in the GML encoding. Please correct the process that generates the GML documents. Typically it was forgotten to add xsi:nil='true' to the property element.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The following properties of the feature have a nil value with an unexpected reason value: {propertyNames}. The nilReason values are: {values}. The nilReason values should either be a URI from the INSPIRE registry (see http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/VoidReasonValue) or from the pre-defined GML values ('unknown', 'other:unpopulated', or 'withheld'). This is an error in the process that writes the INSPIRE GML documents.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial topology element '{elementName}' was found. Spatial properties are limited to the set of geometric types consisting of point, curve with linear interpolation, planar surface, or aggregates thereof. Spatial topology is excluded.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A curve geometry with an invalid curve segment '$elementName' was found. Curves (standalone or within surfaces) must have linear interpolation (LineString, Curve with LineStringSegment segments).
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A surface geometry with an invalid GML object element '$elementName' was found. Planar surface types are restricted to Polygon or Surface elements.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A surface geometry with an invalid GML object element '$elementName' for surface patches was found. Surface patches are restricted to gml:PolygonPatch elements.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A geometry with an invalid GML object element '{elementName}' was found. Supported geometry types are restricted to point, curve with linear interpolation, planar surface, or aggregates thereof.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A {geometryType} geometry with an invalid GML object element for coordinates '{elementName}' was found. Only {posElementName} is allowed.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A geometric aggregate using the array property '{elementName}' was found. Only the standard properties (gml:pointMember for gml:MultiPoint, gml:curveMember for gml:MultiCurve, gml:surfaceMember for gml:MultiSurface, and gml:geometryMember for gml:MultiGeometry) are allowed.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': Coordinates with a dimension '{dimension}' were found. Only coordinate reference systems with 1, 2 or 3 dimensions are allowed.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The feature geometry is not a valid GML geometry.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The lifespan of the feature ends before it begins (property '{propertyEnd}': '{end}', property '{propertyBegin}': '{begin}'). This is logically incorrect.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial or temporal geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system with identifier '{rsid}' that cannot be retrieved. Every URI must be a HTTP URI in a CRS register that when retrieved with HTTP GET returns a definition of the reference system.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The property '{propertyName}' has a value '{value}' that cannot be retrieved using HTTP. Every code list value must be made available in an online registry.

XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A spatial geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system '{crs}'. Please refer to table 2 of the data specification for the list of expected coordinate reference systems.

XML document '{filename}': The default coordinate reference system stated in the bounding box of the feature collection has an unexpected value '{crs}'. Please refer to table 2 of the data specification for the list of expected coordinate reference systems.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A temporal geometry uses an unexpected coordinate reference system '{crs}'. Only 'http://www.opengis.net/def/trs/ISO-8601/' is allowed.

The XML documents representing the spatial data set do not contain a feature of any of the spatial object types in the application schemas of the data theme '{theme}'. Therefore, the spatial data set cannot conform to this conformance class. If you have expected to find spatial objects from the application schemas in the data set, please consult the statistics information to see the spatial object types that have been found.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The geometry is not within a single SurfaceWater feature from the Physical Waters application schema.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': A measurement value in property '{property}' has an unexpected unit '{uom}'. The allowed values are: {allowedUoM}.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The property '{property}' has a value '{value}' that is not one of the allowed values listed at {codelist}.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The node is not located at the start or end of any WatercourseLink feature in the data set.
XML document '{filename}', {featureType} '{gmlid}': The property '{property}' has a value '{value}' that cannot be retrieved using HTTP.
